sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Typewritten letter from Furtwängler to Schenker, dated October 3, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Furtwängler has responded to letters from Schenker and Oswald Jonas by telephoning and obtained permission [for Hans Wolf to travel].
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Furtwängler, Wilhelm; Schenker, Heinrich; Jonas, Oswald

tei:p.tei:hi: Typewritten letter from Furtwängler to Schenker, dated October 3, 1934

tei:transcription.tei:p: Lieber Herr Schenker! Receipt of this letter is recorded in Schenker's diary OJ 4/8, p. 3956, October 24, 1934, and his reply OJ 4/8, p. 3956, October 26, 1934.

Nach Empfang Ihres Briefes This letter is not known to survive. hat sich Herr Dr. Jonas Click on Oswald Jonas. The letter from Jonas to Furtwängler is not known to survive. in derselben Angelegenheit an mich gewandt. (Click on) Hans Wolf, who had traveled from Vienna to Hamburg in September 1934, and then was unable to return until Furtwängler intervened on his behalf. Correspondence between Wolf and Schenker exists concerning this incident. Ich habe <strike>sofort</strike> an die betreffende Stelle telefoniert und es wurde mir zugesagt, dass die Angelegenheit sofort erledigt werden sollte. Hoffentlich hat Ihr Schüler inzwischen die Erlaubnis schon in den Händen.
Mit den schönsten Grüssen [handwritten:], in aller Eile [typewritten:] Ihr [signed:] Wilhelm Furtwängler
[handwritten:] NB: Ich schreibe in den nächsten Tagen nochmal!

tei:p.tei:hi: Typewritten letter from Furtwängler to Schenker, dated October 3, 1934

tei:translation.tei:p: After I had received your letter, Dr. Jonas turned to me on the same matter. I <strike>immediately</strike> telephoned the relevant authority and was promised that the matter would be dealt with immediately. I hope that by now your pupil will in the meantime have received permission.
With very best wishes [handwritten:], in haste, [typewritten:] Yours, [signed:] Wilhelm Furtwängler
[handwritten:] NB: I shall write again in the next few days.
